intro: Globifera bryoides, commonly known as the moss-like liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its small, leafy structure that resembles moss, with closely packed, overlapping leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as gametophytes, are usually found on the underside of the leaves. Globifera bryoides plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem.
